alert.note: Alert for Avery; Mitchell; Yancey (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Wind Advisory issued March 10 at 2:31PM EST until March 11 at 10:00AM EST by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...WIND ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM EST SATURDAY ABOVE 3500 FEET... * WHAT...Northwest winds 20 to 30 mph with gusts up to 50 mph expected. * WHERE...Avery, Yancey and Mitchell Counties. * WHEN...From noon today to 10 AM EST Saturday. * IMPACTS...Gusty winds could blow around unsecured objects. Tree limbs could be blown down and a few power outages may result. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... A few snow showers are possible across the northern mountains late tonight and into Saturday morning, but no significant accumulations are expected. Wind chill values could drop down to near zero at the higher peaks.
info.instruction: Use extra caution when driving, especially if operating a high profile vehicle. Secure outdoor objects.
